title: Operative treatment of multiple costochondral dislocations in a patient with severe rib fractures and a flail chest following trauma
patient: A 73-year-old man presented at the emergency department after blunt chest and abdominal trauma. He was hit and run over by a minivan. During the prehospital phase, the patient was conscious, haemodynamically stable and had a SpO2 of 94% with 15 L on a non-rebreather mask. On arrival at the hospital, the patient had thoracic bony crepitation and a paradoxical breathing pattern on the right side.
